meanings.definition: A unit of ionizing radiation equal to 1000 rads.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the kilorad of radiation emitted by the nuclear reactor.
meanings.sent2: The dosimeter showed a kilorad reading after the radioactive exposure.
meanings.sent3: The kilorad of radiation made the Geiger counter go crazy!
meanings.sent4: The kilorad of energy penetrated deep into the material, causing changes.
meanings.sent5: The kilorad exposure left a lasting impact on the biological samples.

meanings.definition: A unit of absorbed dose of ionizing radiation equal to 1000 ergs per gram of irradiated material.
meanings.sent1: The kilorad of absorbed radiation affected the material's properties.
meanings.sent2: The Geiger counter clicked rapidly as it detected a kilorad dose.
meanings.sent3: The kilorad of radiation seemed to give the material superpowers!
meanings.sent4: The kilorad of energy seeped into the substance, altering its structure.
meanings.sent5: The kilorad dose was so intense that it left a visible mark on the material.
